long:
source: a primitive root,
meaning: to "redeem" (according to the Oriental law of kinship), i.e. to "be the next of kin" (and as such to "buy back" a relative's property, "marry" his widow, etc.)
usage: × in any wise, × at all, avenger, deliver, (do, perform the part of near, next) kinsfolk(-man), purchase, ransom, redeem(-er), revenger.
